item.title: 富士康称正在为 Nvidia 的 GB200 建设全球最大的制造工厂
item.description: 富士康的一位高级主管周二表示，富士康正在为 Nvidia 的 GB200 芯片建造世界上最大的生产设施。【原文：Foxconn is building the world's largest manufacturing facility for Nvidia's GB200 chips, a senior executive at the Taiwanese company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: LG 能源解决方案为梅赛德斯-奔驰北美分公司供应电动汽车电池
item.description: 韩国 LG Energy Solution 公司周二表示，该公司签署了一项协议，将为梅赛德斯-奔驰公司在北美和其他地区的子公司供应电动汽车电池。【原文：South Korea's LG Energy Solution said on Tuesday it signed a deal to supply electric vehicle batteries to a Mercedes-Benz affiliate in North America and other regions.】

item.title: IAM 工会称周二将继续与波音公司谈判
item.description: 国际机械师和航空航天工人协会（IAM）的成员正在波音公司举行罢工，该协会表示将在周二继续与波音公司进行谈判。【原文：The International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers (IAM), whose members are on a strike at Boeing , said that it will continue its negotiation with the planemaker on Tuesday.】

item.title: 中国股市休市一周后轰然重开
item.description: 中国股市周二飙升至两年来的高点，进一步推动了强劲的涨势，因为在长达一周的假期后恢复了交易，而且投资者押注于刺激措施对经济的支持。【原文：Chinese shares soared to two-year highs on Tuesday, pushing a blistering rally even further as trade resumed after a week-long holiday and investors bet on stimulus supporting the economy.】

item.title: 交易员考虑美国利率前景，美元坚守7周高位
item.description: 周二，美元兑主要货币紧守七周高位，因为投资者在上周强劲的就业报告使大幅降息的押注落空之后，正在思考美国利率的前景，而中东紧张局势的升级则削弱了风险情绪。【原文：The dollar clung to seven-week highs against major currencies on Tuesday as investors ponder the outlook for U.S. rates after a strong jobs report last week dashed bets for large rate cuts, while escalating tensions in Middle East dented risk sentiment.】

item.title: 受中东战争风险影响，油价在升至一个多月来最高点后走低
item.description: 周二亚洲交易时段早盘，油价走低，原因是交易商在周一油价反弹至一个多月来最高点后获利了结，因为市场担心中东可能处于爆发全地区战争的边缘。【原文：Oil prices edged lower in early Asian trading hours on Tuesday as traders booked profits after prices rallied to their highest in over a month on Monday amid fears that the Middle East could be on the brink of a region-wide war.】

item.title: 路透社调查：韩国央行将于 10 月 11 日启动宽松周期，降息 25 个基点
item.description: 接受路透社调查的大多数经济学家预计，韩国央行将于周五将其关键利率下调 25 个基点至 3.25%，这将是韩国央行今年唯一一次下调利率，因为韩国央行正试图在经济增长和金融稳定之间取得平衡。【原文：The Bank of Korea will cut its key interest rate by 25 basis points to 3.25% on Friday, according to a majority of economists polled by Reuters who expect that to be the only reduction this year as it attempts to balance growth and financial stability.】

item.title: 中东冲突使市场在中国重新开放前持续紧张
item.description: 周二，全球股市开盘谨慎，油价持续走高，原因是在中国长假后万众瞩目的重新开市之前，中东冲突升级削弱了风险偏好。【原文：Global stocks began Tuesday on a cautious note while oil prices stayed elevated as the escalating conflict in the Middle East sapped risk appetite ahead of China's highly anticipated reopening after a long holiday.】

item.title: 三星第三季度利润不及预期，在人工智能芯片领域举步维艰
item.description: 三星电子（Samsung Electronics）周二预计，其第三季度营业利润将增长 274%，但低于分析师的预期，因为这家科技巨头努力利用人工智能服务器所用芯片的强劲需求。【原文：Samsung Electronics estimated on Tuesday its third-quarter operating profit jumped 274%, but that was short of analysts' estimates as the tech giant struggled to capitalise on strong demand for chips used in artificial intelligence servers.】

item.title: 夏季奖金增加后，日本实际工资再次下降，消费减少
item.description: 本周二的数据显示，日本经通胀调整后的工资在夏季红利季节连续两个月增长后，于8月份出现下降，同时家庭支出也出现下降，这使得日本央行在短期内加息的可能性大打折扣。【原文：Japan's inflation-adjusted wages fell in August after two months of increases during the summer bonus season, while household spending also declined, data showed on Tuesday, knocking chances of the central bank raising interest rates any time soon.】

item.title: 早间竞价美国利率回升，股市回落
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 美联储穆萨勒姆主张更多降息，称数据将推动宽松政策
item.description: 圣路易斯联邦储备银行行长阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆（Alberto Musalem）周一表示，随着经济在健康的道路上向前发展，他支持更多的降息措施，同时指出，央行应该谨慎行事，不要过度放宽货币政策。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President Alberto Musalem said on Monday he supports more interest rate cuts as the economy moves forward on a healthy path, while noting that it is appropriate for the central bank to be cautious and not overdo easing monetary policy.】

item.title: Tinder 母公司 Match 任命内部人士 Steven Bailey 为新任首席财务官
item.description: Tinder 母公司 Match 集团周一任命史蒂文-贝利（Steven Bailey）为新任财务总监，接替加里-斯维德勒（Gary Swidler），于 2025 年 3 月 1 日生效。【原文：Tinder-parent Match Group on Monday named Steven Bailey as its new finance chief, effective March 1, 2025, succeeding Gary Swidler.】

item.title: Cboe 将上市 Precidian 开发的对冲 ADRs
item.description: Precidian Investments 周一推出了对冲型美国预托证券，美国投资者可以用它来购买外国上市股票，同时限制货币波动的影响。【原文：Precidian Investments launched hedged ADRs on Monday that U.S. investors can use to buy foreign-listed stocks while limiting the impact of fluctuating currencies.】

item.title: 加密货币交易所 FTX 的清算计划获得法院批准
item.description: FTX 周一获得了法院对其破产计划的批准，这将使其能够利用自这家曾经领先的加密货币交易所倒闭以来收回的 160 亿美元资产全额偿还客户。【原文：FTX received court approval of its bankruptcy plan on Monday, which will allow it to fully repay customers using $16 billion in assets recovered since the once-leading crypto exchange collapsed.】

item.title: 白宫顾问称美国期待复活更多核反应堆
item.description: 白宫气候顾问阿里-扎伊迪（Ali Zaidi）周一表示，拜登政府正在制定计划，让更多退役的核反应堆重新投入运行，以帮助满足对无排放电力不断增长的需求。【原文：The Biden administration is working on plans to bring additional decommissioned nuclear power reactors back online to help meet soaring demand for emissions-free electricity, White House climate adviser Ali Zaidi said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国法官命令谷歌向竞争对手开放应用商店
item.description: 继去年陪审团对《堡垒之夜》（Fortnite）制作商 Epic Games 做出判决后，一名美国法官周一命令 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司彻底改革其移动应用业务，为安卓用户提供更多下载应用和支付应用内交易费用的选择。【原文：A U.S. judge on Monday ordered Alphabet's Google to overhaul its mobile app business to give Android users more options to download apps and to pay for transactions within them, following a jury verdict last year for “Fortnite” maker Epic Games.】

item.title: 美国众议院小组调查 FCC 拒绝为 Starlink 提供近 9 亿美元资金的决定
item.description: 美国众议院一个委员会周一表示，它正在调查联邦通信委员会拒绝向 SpaceX 卫星互联网部门 Starlink 提供 8.855 亿美元农村宽带补贴的决定。【原文：A U.S. House committee said on Monday it is investigating the Federal Communications Commission's decision to deny SpaceX satellite internet unit Starlink $885.5 million in rural broadband subsidies.】

item.title: 美国法官命令谷歌向竞争对手开放应用商店
item.description: 继去年陪审团对《堡垒之夜》（Fortnite）制作商 Epic Games 做出判决后，一名美国法官周一命令 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司彻底改革其移动应用业务，为安卓用户提供更多下载应用和支付应用内交易费用的选择。【原文：A U.S. judge on Monday ordered Alphabet's Google to overhaul its mobile app business to give Android users more options to download apps and to pay for transactions within them, following a jury verdict last year for “Fortnite” maker Epic Games.】

item.title: 司法部称，让客户为菲斯科汽车召回维修付费是非法的
item.description: 美国司法部周一在一份法庭文件中称，破产电动汽车制造商菲斯科将汽车召回成本转嫁给客户的计划是非法的。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice said in a court filing on Monday that bankrupt electric vehicle maker Fisker's plan to pass on the costs of vehicle recalls to customers is illegal.】

item.title: 美国针对亚马逊的反垄断案将继续推进
item.description: 法庭文件显示，美国联邦贸易委员会指控亚马逊扼杀在线零售业竞争的案件将继续审理，但与该机构一同起诉的一些州的诉讼请求已被驳回。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission's case accusing Amazon of stifling competition in online retail will move forward, though some of the states that sued alongside the agency had their claims dismissed, court documents showed.】

item.title: 密尔顿逼近佛罗里达州，港口限制航行，部分石油设施关闭
item.description: 随着飓风米尔顿的迅速加强，美国墨西哥湾至少有一个石油和天然气平台于周一关闭，佛罗里达州的港口也对船只航行实施了限制。【原文：At least one oil and gas platform in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico was shut on Monday and Florida ports imposed restrictions on vessel navigation as Hurricane Milton rapidly intensified.】

item.title: 飓风季节带来损失，美国财险公司业绩下滑
item.description: 在飓风米尔顿向佛罗里达州西海岸袭来的途中，飓风强度增强为四级，标志着该行业今年要承保的又一场代价高昂的灾难，美国财产和人身保险股周一大幅下挫。【原文：U.S. property and casualty insurance stocks tanked on Monday after Hurricane Milton intensified into a category 4 on its path toward Florida's western coast, marking yet another costly disaster for the industry to cover this year.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮推动 GPU 季度出货量达 10 万台，超微股价大涨
item.description: 超微计算机公司（Super Micro Computer）周一表示，该公司目前每季度的图形处理器出货量超过 10 万台，并推出了一套新的液体冷却产品，这使得这家人工智能服务器制造商的股价在经历了长达数周的暴跌后上涨了约 14%。【原文：Super Micro Computer said on Monday it is currently shipping more than 100,000 graphics processors per quarter and unveiled a new suite of liquid cooling products, sending the AI server maker's shares up about 14% following a weeks-long slump.】

item.title: 通用汽车在飓风相关供应商问题后恢复生产
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）周一表示，由于飓风海伦（Helene）对供应商造成的影响，该公司上周暂时停止了位于得克萨斯州和密歇根州的两家装配厂的生产。【原文：General Motors said Monday it is resuming production at two assembly plants in Texas and Michigan after it temporarily halted production at the plants last week because of impacts to its suppliers due to Hurricane Helene.】

item.title: 意大利检察官发现为波音公司制造的缺陷部件威胁飞机安全
item.description: 检察官周六表示，调查人员发现，两家意大利分包商在为波音公司的 787 Dreamliner 制造某些部件时，使用了更便宜且不符合要求的钛和铝，从而节省了大量资金，但却威胁到了飞机的安全。【原文：Investigators have found that two Italian sub-contractors used cheaper and non-compliant forms of titanium and aluminium to make certain parts for Boeing's 787 Dreamliner, saving significant sums of money and threatening plane safety, prosecutors said on Saturday.】

item.title: 预算组织称，特朗普的税收和支出计划将比哈里斯的计划增加两倍的债务
item.description: 据一家关注预算问题的智库周一估计，共和党总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普的税收和支出计划所产生的新债务将是副总统卡马拉-哈里斯计划的两倍多。【原文：Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's tax and spending plans would produce more than twice as much new debt as the plans from Vice President Kamala Harris, a budget-focused think-tank estimated on Monday.】

item.title: 文件显示，高盛持有价值 6.7% 的联合信贷银行衍生品头寸
item.description: 高盛周一提交的一份监管文件显示，截至 9 月 30 日，高盛在意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）持有的衍生品头寸相当于该银行 6.7% 的股份，其中大部分是掉期和期货合约以及看涨期权。【原文：Goldman Sachs has derivative positions in UniCredit equivalent to a 6.7% stake in the Italian bank as of Sept. 30, mostly swap and future contracts as well as call options, a regulatory filing showed on Monday.】

item.title: 独家报道：联合利华高管称正在全面调整欧洲家庭护理供应链
item.description: 联合利华的一位高级管理人员告诉路透社，联合利华正在斥资超过 1.5 亿欧元（1.65 亿美元）改造其欧洲家庭护理业务的供应链，旨在弥补多年来的业绩不佳，并开发年轻的、大流行后的购物者。【原文：Unilever is spending over 150 million euros ($165 million) to revamp its European homecare business' supply chain, a senior executive told Reuters, aiming to make up for years of underperformance and tap into young, post-pandemic shoppers.】

item.title: 欧盟支持对中国电动汽车征收关税表明柏林的影响力正在减弱
item.description: 德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨（Olaf Scholz）拒绝欧盟对中国电动汽车征收关税，但未能阻止欧盟其他成员国投赞成票，这暴露了分裂的柏林是如何努力推动欧盟政策的。【原文：German Chancellor Olaf Scholz's rejection of EU tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles failed to stop fellow European Union members voting in favour, exposing how a divided Berlin is struggling to drive EU policy.】
